questions.question: The coordinates of the midpoint of points A(3, 7) and B(5, −3) are __________
2. In what ratio does the origin divide the line segment joining points X(5, 10) and Y(−5, 0)? The ratio is _________
options: Origin does not lie on the segment

questions.question: 3. Determine the value of k if the origin divides the segment from A(1, 2) to B(7, k) in the ratio 3 : 1. The value of k is __________
4. The coordinates of the midpoint of points C(2, 4) and D(8, −2) are __________
5. If the origin divides the line segment between points E(−1, −1) and F(4, k) in a ratio of 1 : 2, what is the value of k? __________
6. What are the coordinates of the midpoint between points G(6, 2) and H(−4, 6)? __________
7. In what ratio does the origin divide the line segment joining points I(8, 2) and J(−2, −2)? The ratio is _________
options: Origin does not lie on the line segment

questions.question: 8. If the origin divides the line segment from K(−6, 3) to L(4, k) in the ratio 1 : 4, what is the value of k? __________
9. What are the midpoint coordinates of points M(10, −4) and N(0, 6)? __________
10. If the origin divides the segment joining points O(−4, 2) and P(3, k) in the ratio 2 : 1, find the value of k. __________
11. The coordinates of the midpoint of points Q(−3, 5) and R(1, −3) are __________
12. The origin cuts the line segment between points S(−2, 2) and T(2, k) in a ratio of 1 : 3. What is the value of k? __________
13. What are the coordinates of the midpoint of points U(5, 0) and V(−1, 6)? __________
14. Determine the ratio in which the origin divides the segment joining W(7, 2) and X(−3, 4). The ratio is _________
options: Origin does not lie on the segment

questions.question: 15. If the origin divides the line segment from Y(−5, −5) to Z(5, k) in the ratio 1 : 2, what is the value of k? __________
